253.title: West Bank: The E1 project could end the chance of a Palestinian state
253.summary:
A town called Trump?

It could happen in the Middle East and thousands could be displaced in the process.

After a new law, passed by Israel’s Knesset, settlers now have the right to buy land individually in the West Bank, the Palestinian territory occupied by Israel since 1967.

A project called E1 is back on track.

First launched in the 1990s, then halted by international objections, Donald Trump’s removal of sanctions against settlement development changes everything.

The project could cut the West Bank in two, end the chance of a Palestinian state, and result in a town named after the US President. Raïd Abu Zaideh, Pauline Gordart and Mark Owen report.
253.author: FRANCE24

She is the author of "The Fight of Our Lives: My Time with Zelenskyy, Ukraine's Battle for Democracy, and What It Means for the World". In an interview with British journalist Piers Morgan on Tuesday, the Ukrainian president said he was ready to negotiate directly with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin. Mendel called this a "very realistic approach", saying that "continuing this war of attrition actually is making us weaker". Mendel added that the "majority of the people [in Ukraine] definitely agree [on the need for a] ceasefire".

414.author: David G. Savage

415.title: Senate panel vote clears the way for Kennedy to become health secretary
415.summary: A key Senate committee supports Robert F. Kennedy Jr., President Trump's pick to head the Department of Health and Human Services. The full Senate will vote on his nomination.
415.author: Seema Mehta, Karen Kaplan

416.title: Column: Many will lie about the consequences of Trump's tariffs. The markets won't
416.summary: When the president announced tariffs on China, Canada and Mexico, stocks tumbled, responding to economic realities that politicians and their supporters often ignore.
416.author: Jonah Goldberg

417.title: 'My home has become a cemetery.' Amid cease-fire, Gazans unearth their dead from rubble
417.summary: A Palestinian woman who lost 10 children and her husband shelters in her shattered Gaza home, where four of her youngest remain buried under rubble.
417.author: Bilal Shbair, Laura King

418.title: Businesses close, children skip school for 'a day without immigrants' protest
418.summary: Organizers said they have tracked 250 businesses nationwide that were closed Monday in solidarity with immigrants.
418.author: Andrea Castillo, Malia Mendez, Cindy Carcamo, Gustavo Arellano

419.title: ACLU sues Trump administration for shutting down asylum process at southern border
419.summary: Trump's executive order sought to dismantle asylum at the southern border. Lawyers say it has been illegally extended to migrants inside the country.
419.author: Rachel Uranga

420.title: California breathes sigh of relief with delayed tariffs on Mexico and Canada. China remains in play
420.summary: Stocks largely recover from an early tumble after Trump confirms one-month delay in imposing tariffs on Mexico. But tariffs on China remain in play.
420.author: Don Lee

421.title: Mexico and Canada reach deals with Trump, but China tariffs loom
421.summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Monday that their countries have avoided hefty U.S. tariffs — for now.
421.author: Kate Linthicum, Patrick J. McDonnell

422.title: Column: Trump is creating an imperial presidency — and he's doing it by decree
422.summary: Trump has been back in the White House for two weeks and is already remaking the federal government — and trying to create an imperial presidency.
422.author: Doyle McManus

423.title: English words have invaded Korea. The government is fighting back
423.summary: How do you say "deepfake," "ASAP" and "digital" in Korean? The fight to keep foreign words from diluting the language
423.author: Max Kim

424.title: Thousands rally in downtown Los Angeles, shut down 101 Freeway to protest Trump's immigration policies
424.summary: Draped in Mexican and Salvadoran flags, roughly 1,000 demonstrators gathered near City Hall shortly before noon, blocking traffic at Spring and Temple streets.
424.author: Daniel Miller, Ben Poston

425.title: Column: A president who won't tell the truth about California may unfairly punish the state
425.summary: Trump's bogus claims about his popularity in the Golden State could be laughed off if he hadn't threatened tying wildfire relief to an overhaul of the state's election system. It's both reckless and cruel.
425.author: Mark Z. Barabak

426.title: Trump cuts chaotic path in first weeks, bucking laws and norms in pursuit of promised agenda
426.summary: President Trump in his first weeks back in the White House repeatedly bucked the Constitution in pursuit of his conservative agenda. Democrats decried the ensuing "chaos."
426.author: Kevin Rector

427.title: Mexico and Canada order retaliatory tariffs on U.S. after Trump starts trade war
427.summary: President Trump announced sweeping tariffs on goods imported from Mexico, Canada and China, triggering a trade war and raising fears about consumer costs.
427.author: Kate Linthicum, Don Lee

428.title: This French film about Mexico has 13 Oscar nominations. Why 'Emilia Pérez' is tanking in Mexico
428.summary: Although it's set in Mexico City, French film 'Emilia Pérez' ran into a frost reception on its opening there. Critics cited stereotypes and the lack of a clear message about the narcos it portrays.
428.author: Patrick J. McDonnell, Cecilia Sánchez Vidal

429.title: Trump and the L.A. fires have made for nonstop news. Experts share ways to deal, not reel
429.summary: Experts said many people today feel overwhelmed by the news, but there are ways to reduce such anxiety, in part by reducing scrolling.
429.author: Kevin Rector

430.title: CDC scrubs research databases referencing sexual orientation and gender identity
430.summary: Health researchers began sharing warnings on social media several days ago, urging members of the community to make copies of federal data before the information was removed from the CDC website.
430.author: Corinne Purtill, Karen Kaplan

431.title: Rubio carries anti-immigration message to Latin America in first trip overseas as Trump's top diplomat
431.summary: Rubio has to balance aggressive Trump policies with Latin America's willingness to cooperate. The Panama Canal will be contentious.
431.author: Tracy Wilkinson

432.title: Another unwelcome consequence of climate change: an explosion of urban rats
432.summary: Global warming is worsening droughts, making sea levels rise, and fueling deadly storms. Now scientists have a new problem to add to that list: Climate change is helping rat populations thrive in U.S. cities.
432.author: Karen Kaplan

433.title: Trump's order on antisemitism and 'Hamas sympathizers' has California universities on alert
433.summary: Trump's executive order calling on campuses to address antisemitism has university leaders, faculty and students concerned as the president vows to revoke visas of pro-Palestinian international students who have taken part in protests.
433.author: Jaweed Kaleem

434.title: A fragile Gaza cease-fire holds for now, as Hamas frees eight more hostages
434.summary: Eight hostages held by Hamas militants are returned to Israel as Palestinian prisoner releases proceed — but can the Gaza cease-fire hold?
434.author: Laura King

435.title: Trump's orders have upended U.S. immigration. What legal routes remain?
435.summary: President Trump, in his first days in office, has released a series of executive orders that will reshape the country's immigration system. We lay out the key changes.
435.author: Jessica Garrison, Rebecca Plevin

436.title: As Trump cuts federal jobs, even national parks are on the chopping block
436.summary: As the Trump administration rushes to eliminate federal jobs, even the national parks — among the country's most beloved and least politicized institutions — are in the crosshairs.
436.author: Jack Dolan

437.title: A new Syrian government struggles to reset its corrupt, besieged economy
437.summary: With Syria's corruption-ridden economy in shambles after the overthrow of Bashar Assad, the caretaker government's priority is to raise cash and bring stability.
437.author: Nabih Bulos

438.title: These House newcomers came to the Capitol with big plans. Then the wildfires hit
438.summary: The California infernos were baptism by fire in Washington politics for Reps. Luz Rivas, George Whitesides and Laura Friedman.
438.author: Faith E. Pinho

439.title: Senators challenge Robert Kennedy Jr. on vaccines in confirmation hearing as health secretary
439.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faced aggressive questions about his skepticism of vaccines and other issues during the first of two scheduled Senate confirmation hearings.
439.author: Seema Mehta, Karen Kaplan

440.title: Is Trump pushing his presidential powers beyond what the Constitution allows?
440.summary: Trump is likely to succeed in expanding presidential powers on some fronts because the Constitution generally puts vast power in the hands of the president.
440.author: David G. Savage

441.title: There's a new royal baby in town: Britain's Princess Beatrice welcomes second child early
441.summary: Princess Beatrice, who is ninth in line to the British throne, has welcomed her second child with her husband, millionaire property tycoon Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi.
441.author: Nardine Saad

442.title: Column: No one polices men's bodies the way we police women's bodies
442.summary: As President Trump takes a hammer to reproductive rights, a Mississippi legislator proposes making it illegal to ejaculate without the 'intent to fertilize an embryo.'
442.author: Robin Abcarian

443.title: Column: Trump pardoned a lot of bad apples. Now he and Republicans own the barrelful
443.summary: Republicans have long styled themselves as the party of law and order and 'backing the blue,' but Trump freed people who attacked police. How does that make the country safer?
443.author: Mark Z. Barabak

444.title: Immigration arrests in churches? Some clergy say not so fast
444.summary: Churches took in refugees from battle-scarred Central America in the 1980s, a precursor to their current focus on undocumented immigrants.
444.author: Andrea Castillo

445.title: Chinese films dodging censors have no place to go. Can they crack into Taiwan?
445.summary: Taiwan is an ideal place for Chinese filmmakers to evade censorship. But the island democracy has its own restrictions on what Chinese films are allowed to air.
445.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

446.title: Low math and English scores mark the nation's report card, California and L.A. included
446.summary: Scores nationwide and in California have yet to rebound from pandemic-era declines. Some outcomes continue to get worse. Low math and English scores, California and L.A. included, mark the nation's report card.
446.author: Howard Blume

447.title: Will Mexico accept military flights of deportees? President Sheinbaum deflects on sensitive issue
447.summary: The Trump administration's use of U.S. military aircraft to return deportees has raised alarms throughout Latin America.
447.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

448.title: Federal judge blocks White House freeze on 'financial assistance' amid anger, confusion
448.summary: California will help lead a coalition of states in suing to block a White House budget office order halting "all federal financial assistance."
448.author: Kevin Rector, Faith E. Pinho, Emily Alpert Reyes

449.title: Goldberg: President Trump demands GOP unity. Here's why he might not get it
449.summary: Trump has left the Republican faithful scrambling to explain and defend his actions beyond blind cult-of-personality loyalty. With the slim GOP majorities in Congress, that's not politically manageable
449.author: Jonah Goldberg

450.title: Former Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff will split time between L.A. and New York in new legal job
450.summary: Questions about former Vice President Kamala Harris' plans have swirled since she lost her presidential bid — notably about whether the former California senator and attorney general will run for governor next year.
450.author: Seema Mehta

451.title: Justice Dept. halts legal programs for detained immigrants, cuts off advocates' access to facilities
451.summary: The suspension of advocates' access to immigrant detention centers eliminates most chances for detainees without a lawyer to receive basic legal information.
451.author: Rachel Uranga

452.title: With diminished clout, Californians in Congress struggle to counter Trump's agenda
452.summary: With little power in Republican-led Washington, D.C., California Democrats struggle to mount a countereffort to President Trump's agenda.
452.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

453.title: Thousands of Palestinians stream back to northern Gaza as cease-fire with Israel holds
453.summary: Israeli troops pull back but maintain a watchful eye on the tens of thousands of Gazans who had been displaced during the 15 months of fighting.
453.author: Nabih Bulos

454.title: As Colombia ends its immigration standoff with Trump, Mexico looks eager to avoid a clash
454.summary: Colombia attempted to stand up to Trump's immigration demands, with mixed results. Mexico appears to be playing it safer.
454.author: Kate Linthicum, Tracy Wilkinson

455.title: Calmes: Trump's focus on retribution distracts from the nation's real domestic enemies
455.summary: The new president's enemies aren't America's enemies. If the FBI turns to retribution, what will protect us from the real threats that endanger the nation?
455.author: Jackie Calmes

456.title: Trump and Biden add to long, strange history of presidential pardons
456.summary: Trump's clemency for Jan. 6 rioters and Biden's reprieve for family represent merely the latest chapters in an odd history of the presidential pardon.
456.author: David Wharton

457.title: Is Xavier Becerra's next move running for governor? He's not saying. Yet.
457.summary: Former President Biden's secretary of Health and Human Services is strongly considering running for governor of California, according to allies.
457.author: Seema Mehta

458.title: Trump punishes Colombia for refusing entry to deportation flights
458.summary: He slaps a 25% tariff on Colombian goods and imposes a raft of visa restrictions. Latin American nations are grappling with how to deal with Trump on his signature issue.
458.author: Tracy Wilkinson

459.title: Column: The rise of Silicon Valley, from indifference to lords of the political universe
459.summary: The assembly of billionaires at Trump's inauguration was a display of wealth and power unlike any before. The display was all the more remarkable given how recently many in tech were politically naive or apathetic.
459.author: Mark Z. Barabak

460.title: Trump talks 'free speech' while moving to muzzle those he disagrees with
460.summary: President Trump issued an executive order purporting to end government censorship. Critics scoffed, saying his actions do just the opposite.
460.author: Kevin Rector

461.title: California's growing need for caregivers could collide with a crackdown on immigrants
461.summary: The Trump administration's plans to crack down on immigration and launch mass deportations could drain caregivers from the workforce as California and the country face the needs of an aging population, advocates and experts say.
461.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

462.title: Abcarian: Does Donald Trump's return to power mean it's time to admit he's right? In a word, no
462.summary: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde's plea to Trump the day after his inauguration exemplified the principled criticism the president deserves regardless of his victory.
462.author: Robin Abcarian

463.title: Opinion: Trump promised to end the Ukraine war, but neither side is ready
463.summary: As Eisenhower once said of how conflicts end, 'sometimes it just gets down to the dirty job of killing until one side or the other cracks.'
463.author: ML Cavanaugh

464.title: Stranded in Mexico City, these migrants hoping to reach the United States have no good options
464.summary: The 1,500 migrants living in this Mexico City encampment face hard choices with President Trump in office.
464.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

465.title: Community groups set up strike teams to respond to Trump's mass deportation plans
465.summary: Community groups are dusting off the rapid-response networks they built during President Trump's first administration to prepare for immigration sweeps in California's agricultural heartland.
465.author: Rebecca Plevin

466.title: Visiting L.A. after firestorm, Trump focuses on overhauling California water policy
466.summary: President Trump says he plans to issue an order to 'open up the pumps' and deliver more water from the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta to California farms and cities.
466.author: Ian James

467.title: Supreme Court will decide if religious schools may be funded as public charters
467.summary: The Supreme Court agreed to hear a new church-state case that could yield a potentially momentous decision and change the funding of public schools in much of the nation.
467.author: David G. Savage

468.title: Trump revokes the security detail of Dr. Anthony Fauci, who has faced death threats
468.summary: Trump revoked the security for Dr. Anthony Fauci, the infectious disease expert and former advisor turned critic who faces regular threats to his life.
468.author: Associated Press and Times staff

469.title: Cease-fire in Gaza Strip was widely welcomed. It may not last. Here's why
469.summary: Powerful forces in Middle East and, now, in Washington working against truce lasting beyond its first phase.
469.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King

470.title: Opinion: It's now clear that America's death penalty is dying one generation at a time
470.summary: Capital punishment has continued to become rarer in recent years, and public opinion of the practice keeps growing dimmer with time.
470.author: Austin Sarat

471.title: Meet the first couples to wed as Thailand legalizes same-sex marriage
471.summary: Thailand has long been known as a haven for LGBTQ+ communities. It is only the third place in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage, behind Taiwan in 2019 and Nepal in 2023.
471.author: Stephanie Yang

472.title: Trump's rebuke to 'gender ideology' changes federal policy and sets up clash with California
472.summary: The executive order conflicts with laws in California and other blue states that forbid discrimination based on gender identity. The courts are expected to take up the issue.
472.author: David G. Savage

473.title: Under Trump, we could be flying blind when it comes to bird flu, other infectious diseases
473.summary: President Trump announced he's pulling the U.S. from the WHO. Now researchers are scrambling to understand what that means for the H5N1 bird flu pandemic.
473.author: Susanne Rust

474.title: Alawites wary as a post-Assad Syria takes shape
474.summary: Once Syria's most influential minority, Alawites struggle to move on from their association with a hated dictator.
474.author: Nabih Bulos

475.title: U.S. and Australia have long fought fires together. Climate change threatens joint efforts
475.summary: U.S. officials didn't even bother to ask Australia for help battling the Los Angeles fires.
475.author: Max Kim, Maria Petrakis

476.title: Less process than 'a traffic ticket': ACLU sues to stop Trump's fast-track deportation policy
476.summary: ACLU sues to stop Trump policy that allows immediate deportation of some immigrants. The new policy could pave the way for mass expulsions.
476.author: Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga

477.title: 'Scare tactic': Bonta slams Trump move targeting local officials over immigration
477.summary: The Department of Justice is planning to investigate and possibly prosecute state and local officials who hinder Trump administration immigration efforts.
477.author: Faith E. Pinho, Keri Blakinger, Ruben Vives

478.title: Calmes: President Trump's Jan. 6 pardons broke his promise to the nation
478.summary: The new/old president seems to have a memory issue. 'You will pay,' he told Jan. 6 lawbreakers in 2021. You're free to go, he said Monday.
478.author: Jackie Calmes

479.title: 'Freaked out': Fear, uncertainty grip California's immigrant community as Trump rolls out crackdown plan
479.summary: Worry spreads over what Trump's orders will mean for California immigrants. One in eight state residents are undocumented or live with a family member who is.
479.author: Ruben Vives, Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga, Rebecca Plevin

480.title: Biden, Harris in California, and soon Trump will be too
480.summary: Former President Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden are spending their first days after leaving the White House in Santa Barbara County.
480.author: Seema Mehta

481.title: Musk says his gestures at Trump inauguration event weren't Nazi salutes
481.summary: Musk made the gestures during a giddy speech celebrating Trump's return to power at a rally Monday at Capital One Arena in Washington. Many condemn the gestures, but not the ADL.
481.author: Kevin Rector

482.title: What did Trump's team learn from past legal battles? Immigrant advocates prepare to find out
482.summary: Immigrants rights groups are already contesting President Trump's sweeping executive orders aimed at combating illegal immigration.
482.author: Andrea Castillo

483.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
483.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
483.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

484.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
484.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
484.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

485.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
485.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
485.author: Robin Abcarian

486.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
486.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
486.author: Kevin Rector

487.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
487.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
487.author: Seema Mehta

488.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
488.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
488.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

489.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
489.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
489.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

490.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
490.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
490.author: Lila Seidman

491.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
491.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
491.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

492.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
492.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
492.author: Doyle McManus

493.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
493.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
493.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

494.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
494.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
494.author: Kevin Rector

495.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
495.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
495.author: Seema Mehta

496.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
496.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
496.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

497.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
497.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
497.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

498.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
498.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
498.author: A.T. McWilliams

499.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
499.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
499.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

500.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
500.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
500.author: Karen Kaplan

501.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
501.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
501.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

502.title: News Analysis: Once again, the world sizes up a Trump presidency
502.summary: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office again, the world watches with a sense that, this time, those outside the U.S. have a better idea what to expect.
502.author: Laura King, Tracy Wilkinson

503.title: Opinion: If Martin Luther King Jr. were alive, how would he have approached the Trump era?
503.summary: The president-elect's inauguration takes place on the holiday honoring the civil rights leader, prompting us to consider how King might respond to Trump's America.
503.author: Earl Ofari Hutchinson

504.title: Opinion: Experts once thought highly of Biden's presidency. Here's how his legacy is likely to change
504.summary: A year ago, a survey of presidential scholars put him in the top third of chief executives while Trump ranked last. But that was before the 2024 election and campaign.
504.author: Brandon Rottinghaus and Justin Vaughn

505.title: Trump's first inaugural speech was 'American carnage.' He says this time will be different
505.summary: Will Trump take the opportunity this time, in his second inaugural speech, to talk of unity? Or will it be more 'American carnage'?
505.author: Doyle McManus

506.title: Column: Why's it so hard to do the right thing and honor the true heroes of Jan. 6?
506.summary: Nearly three years after passage of legislation to place a commemorative plaque on the western front of the Capitol there is still no action. Speaker Mike Johnson and other Trump allies are trying to bury history.
506.author: Mark Z. Barabak

507.title: Calmes: Biden delivered a new 'Roaring '20s.' Watch Trump try to take the credit
507.summary: No matter what the new president says, the facts show that Joe Biden left America in better economic shape than he found it.
507.author: Jackie Calmes

508.title: Supporters of South Korea's Yoon storm courthouse. Some see hope in Trump's return
508.summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's supporters storm the courthouse that issued a warrant extending his detention, climbing walls and smashing windows.
508.author: Max Kim

509.title: Donald Trump Jr's 'Soros' reply to 'I didn't vote for Elon Musk': Cry harder
509.summary: Donald Trump Jr shared a collage of photos of Alex Soros with Democratic leaders including Joe Biden, Kamala Harris and Barack Obama and said he did not vote for Soros ever. But the difference is, Donald Trump Jr said, Trump was elected in a landslide with full transparency that Elon Musk would be doing exactly what he is doing.
509.author: TOI World Desk

510.title: Eric Adams admits he was unwell, under anesthesia; but does not reveal 'mystery illness'
510.summary: New York City Mayor Eric Adams revealed he was unwell last week and underwent anesthesia for medical tests. Although he didn't specify the issue, he said all his test results were negative. Some of his illnesses are related to diabetes, and he plans to return to a more plant-based diet.
510.author: TOI World Desk

511.title: Boy who protected sister from plane crash debris is making 'miraculous' recovery
511.summary: A 10-year-old boy is recovering after shielding his younger sister from debris of a crashed medical transport plane in Philadelphia. Trey Howard, who underwent emergency brain surgery, asked if he saved his sister upon waking. The crash killed all six onboard and a seventh person on the ground, injuring 24 others.

512.title: MAGA claims 'Politico' received money from USAID: 'The corruption is endless'
512.summary: MAGA spokespersons claimed Politico was funded by USAID as Trump and Musk pushing for the agency's shutdown. They alleged that this led to Politico staff not being paid, highlighting a major scandal. Politico, however, blamed a technical error in an internal email that addressed the issue of salary getting delayed this month.
512.author: TOI World Desk

513.title: Greek defense minister calls for EU to loosen strict defense spending limits
513.summary: Greece’s defense minister Nikos Dendias urged the EU to ease strict defense spending limits, calling them "schizophrenic" amid growing security concerns. He emphasized that military self-sufficiency requires greater financial flexibility, aligning with Nato commitments. Greece and Cyprus, along with 19 other EU states, support expanded access to European Investment Bank funds for defense. Key decisions on EU military strengthening will be ratified at an upcoming summit.

514.title: 'Cocaine is illegal because ...': Colombian President Petro proposes cocaine legalization
514.summary: Colombian President Gustavo Petro suggested that legalizing cocaine worldwide could diminish criminal organizations' profits and compared its harm to whisky. He also urged undocumented Colombians in the U.S. to return home, promising government support for their reintegration and emphasizing the creation of social wealth in Colombia.
514.author: TOI World Desk

515.title: Has Elon Musk employed 19-year-olds for DOGE? Donald Trump reacts...
515.summary: Donald Trump acknowledged that Elon Musk hired young people -- as young as 19-year-olds-- for crucial DOGE work. He said he never met them though they work out of the White House but they are very smart people. "Some are young and some are not young. Some are not young at all. But they found great things," Trump said.
515.author: TOI World Desk

516.title: 'Deny, Defend, Depose': Musk's mural defaced amid growing criticism over his Role in Trump govt
516.summary: A mural of Elon Musk in Texas was defaced due to concerns over his collaboration with the Trump administration, particularly his role in reducing federal expenditure and dismantling USAID. The vandalism, featuring the phrase 'Deny, Defend, Depose,' underscores fears about Musk's unregulated influence on government policies despite his status as a special government employee.
516.author: TOI World Desk

517.title: Blackhawk helicopter was flying too high but it had complex flying conditions: New revelations
517.summary: The investigation into the fatal DC plane crash has not yet blamed the Army Blackhawk helicopter but confirmed that it was flying higher than what was permitted. According to experts, 200 feet was too low for the helicopter as the airspace around Ronald Reagan National Airport is busy. The lighting conditions around the Potomac River are tough and there's not many place in the world where all these conditions are present all at once, experts said.
517.author: TOI World Desk

518.title: Kamala Harris' campaign lying about coming on my show, claims Joe Rogan. 'Trump was really easy to book'
518.summary: Joe Rogan said Kamala Harris never gave him a date for her appearance on his show and her team had many conditions for a Joe Rogan interview. His statement came as a forthcoming book has now claimed that Kamala Harris made every attempt to appear on the show and even planned a Houston rally so that she could stop by Rogan's Texas studio but it did not finally materialize, signaling that Rogan is to be blamed for it.
518.author: TOI World Desk

519.title: 'Trump heard free Palestine and said sold'
519.author: TOI World Desk

520.title: Sweden shooter's name not yet revealed by police: 35-year-old, unemployed recluse
520.summary: Swedish Police have not yet revealed the name of the shooter who opened fire at an adult education center in Orobro killing at least 10 people before ending his own life. Amid unconfirmed reports that the shooter was some Rickard Andersson, police confirmed that he was a 35-year-old unemployed recluse but the police did not confirm the name or the viral photos of the person.
520.author: TOI World Desk

521.title: Pakistan's president says terrorist attacks won't end friendship with China
521.summary: During a visit to China, Pakistan's President Asif Ali Zardari assured that his country's enduring friendship with China will not be broken by terrorist attacks. Despite recent attacks targeting Chinese workers in Pakistan, Zardari emphasized the unshakable bond between the two nations, which has been vital for initiatives like the belt and road initiative. Chinese President Xi Jinping echoed Zardari's sentiments, highlighting their cooperation in the China-Pakistan economic corridor and other ventures.

522.title: Philippine house votes to impeach VP Sara Duterte
522.summary: The Philippine house of representatives voted to impeach vice president Sara Duterte on Wednesday, accusing her of constitutional violations, graft, corruption, and plotting to assassinate President Ferdinand Marcos. The impeachment paves the way for a senate trial, where two-thirds of the 24 senators must vote for her removal. Duterte's impeachment follows allegations of misuse of public funds and a deteriorating relationship with Marcos. The case has sparked political debates, with the Senate trial seen as a potential opportunity for politicians ahead of the 2028 presidential race.

523.title: Donald Trump shows Elon Musk who's in charge, rejects request of hiring Turkish-born Baris Akis for DOGE
523.summary: President Donald Trump rejected Elon Musk's request to hire Turkish-born Silicon Valley leader Baris Akis for the department of government efficiency. Trump's aides told Elon Musk that at a time when the administration is deporting people, bringing in a foreign national to help minimize the government spending would send a confusing message.
523.author: TOI World Desk

524.title: CIA offers buyout to entire staff as Donald Trump pushes to shrink federal workforce
524.summary: The CIA is offering buyouts to its entire workforce, making it the first intelligence agency to implement Donald Trump's voluntary redundancy program for federal employees. This includes halting the hiring of certain candidates. The initiative aims to align the CIA's workforce with national security priorities and Trump's government efficiency goals. This development follows Trump's proposal regarding the Gaza Strip.
524.author: TOI World Desk

525.title: Trump bid to take over Gaza, move Palestinians faces backlash
525.summary: President Donald Trump's proposal for the United States to take control of the Gaza Strip and resettle its people was met with widespread condemnation from Palestinians and leaders across the globe. While Trump suggested transforming Gaza into a prosperous region with US ownership, Palestinian officials and regional leaders, including Hamas and Egyptian authorities, rejected the idea as a violation of Palestinian rights. Trump’s vague plan was criticized for its lack of details on implementation, with many expressing concerns about forced displacement and occupation.

526.title: Tokyo police bust alleged prostitution ring targeting tourists
526.summary: Japanese police arrested seven people, including a Brazilian national, for running an illegal prostitution ring disguised as massage parlors in Tokyo’s Kabukicho red-light district. The group, led by 54-year-old Kazuki Sudo, allegedly targeted foreign tourists, with 60-70 per cent of clients from abroad. They operated an English-language website and accepted multiple currencies. Authorities are concerned that Japan’s tourism boom is fueling the underground sex industry.

527.title: Iran's Khamenei names Hezbollah leader as Lebanon 'representative'
527.summary: Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has appointed Hezbollah leader Naim Qassem as his representative in Lebanon, responsible for religious and non-litigious affairs. Qassem succeeds Hassan Nasrallah, who was killed in an Israeli airstrike. Hezbollah, part of Iran's "axis of resistance," delayed public commemorations for Nasrallah and Hashem Safieddine until a February 23 funeral due to security concerns amid recent Israel-Lebanon tensions.

528.title: Russia sets appeal date for jailed French researcher
528.summary: A Russian court has set a February 24 appeal hearing for French researcher Laurent Vinatier, jailed for three years for failing to register as a "foreign agent." Vinatier, working for a Swiss mediation NGO, admitted guilt, claiming ignorance of the law. France has condemned the case, which comes amid strained Russia-France relations over Ukraine. His lawyers argue the sentence is excessively harsh and sought a fine instead.

749.title: Why Trumps Tariffs Cant Solve Americas Fentanyl Crisis
749.summary:
Feb 05 (IPS) - Americans consume more illicit drugs per capita than anyone else in the world; about 6% of the U.S. population uses them regularly. One such drug, fentanyl – a synthetic opioid that’s 50 to 100 times more potent than morphine – is the leading reason U.S. overdose deaths have surged in recent years. While the rate of fentanyl overdose deaths has dipped a bit recently, it’s still vastly higher than it was just five years ago.

Read the full story, “Why Trumps Tariffs Cant Solve Americas Fentanyl Crisis”, on globalissues.org →

750.title: Pakistan: Freedom of Expression at Stake With New Cybercrime Law
750.summary:
KARACHI, Feb 05 (IPS) - “I may not be able to continue hosting my show because the content I put up will most certainly land me in prison,” said senior correspondent Azaz Syed who works for a private TV channel, but who also has his own private online digital channel. He was referring to the recent amendment in the already existing cybercrime law, terming it a “wild” law which has been instituted to grapple with fake news among other online harms.

Read the full story, “Pakistan: Freedom of Expression at Stake With New Cybercrime Law”, on globalissues.org →

753.title: Afghanistan’s Humanitarian Crisis Expected to Worsen in 2025
753.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Feb 04 (IPS) - The humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan has deteriorated significantly since the 2021 Taliban Offensive, an insurgency that resulted in the Taliban’s reclamation of power and the fall of the nation’s republic. In 2024, the Taliban issued further restrictions on human rights in Afghanistan, particularly for women and girls. These restrictions caused the country to enter a state of economic emergency. This, compounded with heightened insecurity and limited access to basic services, has left over 23 million people in dire need of humanitarian assistance.

Read the full story, “Afghanistan’s Humanitarian Crisis Expected to Worsen in 2025”, on globalissues.org →

754.title: A Potential New Battle: UN vs US over Greenland and the Panama Canal
754.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Feb 04 (IPS) - US President Donald Trump’s ominous threat to take over the Panama Canal and Greenland sets the stage for a new political battle with the United Nations.

But judging by UN’s track record of failures—including the US invasion of Iraq in 2003, and the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine—the world body may lose again while battling a veto-wielding superpower.

Read the full story, “A Potential New Battle: UN vs US over Greenland and the Panama Canal”, on globalissues.org →
